item.description:
As most of you know, every now and then I like to revisit our tradition-in-the-making...our poetry readings, or as I call them, our literary gift-giving. Let's end the summer with one! Let us each bring a poem or two that we love and would like to share with the group. In the past people have brought poems long and short, or excerpts from epics or novels in verse (Homer and Pushkin qualify!), often from the usual suspects, but sometimes not. If you could introduce us to something new or get us to experience a poem we already know in a new way, you'll have accomplished what we're after.

You'll have up to five minutes of our attention. So, choose wisely. You may decide to participate or to simply listen. If possible, let us know in advance your selection, and if you can, bring copies of the piece to share with the group (it makes it easier to follow).

I leave you with "Late Summer" by Jennifer Grotz

http://www.poetryfoundation.org/poem/243972

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: Poetry Reading
